column3:
The dog was playing in the street outside. I walked past the dog and threw the ball to
ewlinehim. He seemed to be hot from the heat of the day. I then headed to the store because I
ewlineneeded to buy some food and other things that were needed. I entered the store and said hi
ewlineto Mr. Jones. He had been working at the store for a long time. I walked to the back of
ewlinethe store and picked up some cold sodas and a bottle of orange juice. I then went and
ewlinepicked up some popcorn. This would be good for eating later while watching tv. I then went
ewlineto the dog food section and picked a meat treat for the dog. I then went up to the front
ewlineof the store and paid Mr. Jones. He smiled and thanked me for shopping at his store. Then
ewlineI walked back to my house and looked at the dog. His name was Rex and had lived with us
ewlinefor around four years. His coat was brown and white. I unwrapped the dog treat and gave it
ewlineto him. Rex seemed happy and started to lick my hand in happiness. He was a good dog and
ewlineit made me feel good that he was happy.

column9: one: what color was the dog
column14: one: what is the name of the dog
